Summary I am a highly collaborative Fortune 100 Operations leader. By building strong relationships in matrixed environments, designing and optimizing operating models, leveraging my schedule/routing/dispatch expertise, and developing highly respected field support teams, I have built a brand around improving efficiencies in diverse domestic and international markets. 
 
I have more than 15 years of leadership and operational experience in retail stores and corporate settings. I am known for: 
 
RELATIONSHIP BUILDING 
♦ Collaboration – I bring diverse teams together with a keen focus on achieving common goals. 
♦ Consensus Building – I believe in bringing people along for the journey. By brainstorming and listening to everyone's unique perspective, people know their voice is heard and are more engaged in delivering a successful solution.  
♦ Networking - I reach out to people across the enterprise to increase my knowledge of the business, find developmental opportunities for my team, and ensure I am not duplicating work.  
 
STRATEGIC PROBLEM SOLVING 
♦ Strategic Planning – I collaborate with cross-functional partners to align on business goals, then create a vision for my team around how we can make it happen. 
♦ Execution - I have a great sense of responsibility and make sure that my team consistently exceeds its commitments. 
 
RESULTS ORIENTED PROJECT MANAGEMENT 
♦ Values-Based Leadership – I am a people-focused leader known for people development, speed to action, and coaching people to meet clearly defined deadlines and goals. 
♦ Continuous Improvement Mindset - I am always digging into processes looking for a better way, which I quickly share across the enterprise to maximize profitability and customer satisfaction.

Manager - Geek Squad In-Home Ops | Workforce Optimization | SRD | Continuous Improvement Best Buy 2008  –  2014  (6 years) Richfield, MN Led a team of 8 senior analysts directing day-to-day operations for 3000+ in-home Agents fulfilling over 1M service calls per year with annual payroll exceeding $100M. Owned optimization of $50M scheduling, routing, and dispatch system.  
 
PROJECT MANAGEMENT DRIVES RESULTS 
♦ Operating Model Design – Leader on team that rebuilt and nationally deployed new operating models. Combined install and repair businesses, homogenized the workforce, and reduced headcount to align with demand by market, improving the bottom line by $30M each of the last two years. 
 
CREATED STRATEGY TO MAXIMIZE PROFIT 
♦ New Capability Design – Built a centralized team that owned market setup nationally - ideal start locations, skill sets, vehicles, schedules, and crew size by market to minimize drive time. Realized $25M in annual labor savings and created consistency for 500+ markets. 
♦ Asset Management – Partnered with procurement teams and designed holistic asset management reporting, then worked with field leadership to retire $8M in underutilized vehicles, cell phones, and laptops.  
 
CROSS-FUNCTIONAL COLLABORATION/CONSULTATION 
♦ International Expansion – Spent 7 months in Mexico, Turkey, and the U.K. helping the in-country corporate teams understand how to run a profitable business, including pricing, labor, headcount, operations, and schedule/routing/dispatch best practices. 
♦ Customer Satisfaction – Worked with cross-functional partners to build an automated process to outsource jobs we couldn't fulfill within 5 days. Negative sales comp of -5% went to +10% in the first month, and overall customer satisfaction NPS went from 80 to 85. Manager- Geek Squad Business Operations | Labor Optimization | Reporting Design | Training Best Buy 2006  –  2008  (2 years) Richfield, MN ♦ Supported labor and headcount forecasting/management for 20,000+ Agents across four business units. 
♦ Utilized Lean Six Sigma methodology and designed a report which allowed the field to adjust labor spend based on sales trends, driving higher labor utilization and improving appointment availability.  
♦ Planned and deployed a new operating model for in-home Geek Squad, pooling labor from stores into virtual hubs to maximize efficiency and customer satisfaction. General Manager Best Buy 2004  –  2005  (1 year) Greater Minneapolis-St. Paul Area ♦ Outperformed sales and margin budgets for six months after grand opening of Eden Prairie store, earning double bonuses each month. 
♦ Performed a stretch role to test Store Services Manager role - helped shape position responsibilities and prove out value for national launch. Store Manager - SuperTarget Target 2002  –  2004  (2 years) Davenport, Iowa Area ♦ Proactively managed store operations (annual sales of $55 million) and led team of 17 assistant managers and 450 team members. 
♦ Identified by regional leadership as a high-potential store manager, attended leadership development series. 
♦ Received award for achieving sales, margin, expense, and profit goals for the year, despite having a Wal-Mart Super Center, Hy-Vee, and Fareway open nearby in 2003-4. Assistant Store Manager Target 1994  –  2002  (8 years) IA, MN, WI, IL Responsible for driving sales, employee and store leadership, and product logistics. Activities included recruiting and hiring, training, coaching, and corrective action. Summary Accomplished, results-driven Program Management consultant with over 12 years of experience in managing staff and project teams over multiple professional disciplines including program / project management, PMO management, resources demand management, IT, business process improvements, software development, marketing & communications and non-profit management. 
 
Certifications & Traning: 
* Project Management Professional (PMP®) 
* Certified SCRUM Product Owner (CSPO®) 
* Certified SCRUM Master (CSM®) 
* Lean Change Agent 
* ITIL Foundation 
* Six Sigma 
* Rational Unified Process (RUP) 
 
Strong knowledge of PMI, PMBOK and SDLC project methodologies. Strong MS Project, CA Clarity PPM, Open Workbench, MS Excel, MS Access, and SharePoint skills.  
 
Career Highlights: 
* Establishing Project Management Offices (PMO) from the ground up 
* Leading business process improvements to reduce costs and complexity 
* Driving large complex programs across multiple platforms in a fast-paced aggressive environment using Agile principles 
* Superior client management, team development and inter-personal skills 
* Non-profit Management 
* Training, Coaching & Communications 
 
Specialties: Program/PMO and Project Management 
Project Portfolio Management 
Business Process Improvements (SCRUM, Agile, Lean, ITIL) 
Performance Management 
Client Relationship Management 
Vendor Management	 
Contract Management 
Management / IT Consulting 
Coaching, Mentoring & Training 
Software Development 
Mobile Application Development
